Description: Bronze figure of Osiris-Iah wearing the lunar-disc and a striated lappet-wig with a uraeus and holding a wedjat-eye to the chest; seated on a throne supported by papyrus-columns and with a vulture at the back; the edges of the base are inscribed with hieroglyphic text invoking Osiris-Iah on behalf of Pashertaihet son of Pakhar and Takhy-...
Curator's comments: Published: GRIFFITHS, J. Gwyn, Osiris and the Moon in Iconography, JEA 62 (1976), 153-159: p. 158.
